      • login

        @PostMapping("/login")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> login​(@RequestBody
                                                        Player player)
        This method maps POST request to /login.
        Parameters:
        player - Player information that will be used for login action
        Returns:
        JwtResponse with the current sessions JWTToken

      • getPlayerID

        @GetMapping("/getPlayerID")
public java.lang.Long getPlayerID​(@RequestParam("username")
                                  java.lang.String username)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        This method maps GET request to /getUserID.
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the player whose ID is wanted
        Returns:
        The ID of the player with given username
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if ID does not exist or user is deleted

      • getAllPlayers

        @GetMapping("/players")
public java.util.List<Player> getAllPlayers()
        This method maps GET request to /players.
        Returns:
        List of all users

      • getPlayer

        @GetMapping("/player")
public Player getPlayer​(@RequestParam("id")
                        java.lang.Long Id)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This method maps GET request to /player.
        Parameters:
        Id - ID of the user that is wanted
        Returns:
        Player with the given ID
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if ID does not exist or user is deleted

      • register

        @PostMapping("/register")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> register​(@RequestBody
                                                           Player player)
        This method maps POST request to /register. It saves new valid Player to database. If player is not valid or credentials are bad, returns a message about that error.
        Parameters:
        player - Player information that will be registered
        Returns:
        Response message of the server

      • updatePlayer

        @PutMapping("/player")
public java.lang.String updatePlayer​(@RequestBody
                                     Player player,
                                     @RequestParam("id")
                                     java.lang.Long Id)
        This method maps PUT request to /profile. It updates player's information with given parameters. If player is not valid or credentials are bad, returns a message about that error.
        Parameters:
        player - Player information that will be registered
        Id - ID of the player that will be updated
        Returns:
        Response message of the server as String

      • processResetPassword

        @PostMapping("/forgotpassword")
public java.lang.String processResetPassword​(@RequestParam("mail")
                                             java.lang.String mail,
                                             @RequestParam("username")
                                             java.lang.String username)
